verses.text: And it came to pass, after the \w year|strong="H8141"\w* was \w expired|strong="H8666"\w*, at the \w time|strong="H6256"\w* when \w kings|strong="H4428"\w* go \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* \add to battle\add*, that \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, and his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* with him, and all \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*; and they \w destroyed|strong="H7843"\w* the \w children|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Ammon|strong="H5983"\w*, and \w besieged|strong="H6696"\w* \w Rabbah|strong="H7237"\w*. But \w David|strong="H1732"\w* tarried \w still|strong="H3427"\w* at \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*.\f + \fr 11.1 \ft after…: Heb. at the return of the year, or, in the spring\f*

¶ And it came to pass in an \w eveningtide|strong="H6153"\w*, that \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w arose|strong="H6965"\w* from off his \w bed|strong="H4904"\w*, and \w walked|strong="H1980"\w* upon the \w roof|strong="H1406"\w* of the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*: and from the \w roof|strong="H1406"\w* he \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* a \w woman|strong="H0802"\w* \w washing|strong="H7364"\w* herself; and the \w woman|strong="H0802"\w* \add was\add* \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w beautiful|strong="H2896"\w* to look \w upon|strong="H4758"\w*.

And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* and \w enquired|strong="H1875"\w* after the \w woman|strong="H0802"\w*. And \add one\add* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \add Is\add* not this \w Bath-sheba|strong="H1339"\w*, the \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* of \w Eliam|strong="H0463"\w*, the \w wife|strong="H0802"\w* of \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w* the \w Hittite|strong="H2850"\w*?\f + \fr 11.3 \ft Bath-sheba: or, Bath-shuah\f*\f + \fr 11.3 \ft Eliam: or Ammiel\f*

And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* \w messengers|strong="H4397"\w*, and \w took|strong="H3947"\w* her; and she came \w in|strong="H0935"\w* unto him, and he \w lay|strong="H7901"\w* with her; for she was \w purified|strong="H6942"\w* from her \w uncleanness|strong="H2932"\w*: and she \w returned|strong="H7725"\w* unto her \w house|strong="H1004"\w*.\f + \fr 11.4 \ft for she…: or, and when she had purified herself, etc, she returned\f*

And the \w woman|strong="H0802"\w* \w conceived|strong="H2029"\w*, and \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* and \w told|strong="H5046"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, I \add am\add* with \w child|strong="H2030"\w*.

¶ And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* to \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, \add saying\add*, \w Send|strong="H7971"\w* me \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w* the \w Hittite|strong="H2850"\w*. And \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w* to \w David|strong="H1732"\w*.

And when \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w* was \w come|strong="H0935"\w* unto him, \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w demanded|strong="H7592"\w* \add of him\add* how \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w did|strong="H7965"\w*, and how the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w did|strong="H7965"\w*, and how the \w war|strong="H4421"\w* \w prospered|strong="H7965"\w*.\f + \fr 11.7 \ft how Joab…: Heb. of the peace of, etc\f*

And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* to \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w*, Go \w down|strong="H3381"\w* to thy \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and \w wash|strong="H7364"\w* thy \w feet|strong="H7272"\w*. And \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w* departed \w out|strong="H3318"\w* of the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and there \w followed|strong="H0310"\w* him a \w mess|strong="H4864"\w* \add of meat\add* from the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*.\f + \fr 11.8 \ft followed…: Heb. went out after him\f*

But \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w* \w slept|strong="H7901"\w* at the \w door|strong="H6607"\w* of the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w* with all the \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* of his \w lord|strong="H0113"\w*, and went not \w down|strong="H3381"\w* to his \w house|strong="H1004"\w*.

And when they had \w told|strong="H5046"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w* went not \w down|strong="H3381"\w* unto his \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w*, \w Camest|strong="H0935"\w* thou not from \add thy\add* \w journey|strong="H1870"\w*? why \add then\add* didst thou not go \w down|strong="H3381"\w* unto thine \w house|strong="H1004"\w*?

And \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, The \w ark|strong="H0727"\w*, and \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, and \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, \w abide|strong="H3427"\w* in \w tents|strong="H5521"\w*; and my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, and the \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* of my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w*, are \w encamped|strong="H2583"\w* in the \w open|strong="H6440"\w* \w fields|strong="H7704"\w*; shall \w I|strong="H0589"\w* then \w go|strong="H0935"\w* into mine \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, to \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* and to \w drink|strong="H8354"\w*, and to \w lie|strong="H7901"\w* with my \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*? \add as\add* thou \w livest|strong="H2416"\w*, and \add as\add* thy \w soul|strong="H5315"\w* \w liveth|strong="H2416"\w*, I will not \w do|strong="H6213"\w* this \w thing|strong="H1697"\w*.

And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* to \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w*, \w Tarry|strong="H3427"\w* here to \w day|strong="H3117"\w* also, and to \w morrow|strong="H4279"\w* I will let thee \w depart|strong="H7971"\w*. So \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w* \w abode|strong="H3427"\w* in \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* that \w day|strong="H3117"\w*, and the \w morrow|strong="H4283"\w*.

And when \w David|strong="H1732"\w* had \w called|strong="H7121"\w* him, he did \w eat|strong="H0398"\w* and \w drink|strong="H8354"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* him; and he made him \w drunk|strong="H7937"\w*: and at \w even|strong="H6153"\w* he went \w out|strong="H3318"\w* to \w lie|strong="H7901"\w* on his \w bed|strong="H4904"\w* with the \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* of his \w lord|strong="H0113"\w*, but went not \w down|strong="H3381"\w* to his \w house|strong="H1004"\w*.

¶ And it came to pass in the \w morning|strong="H1242"\w*, that \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w wrote|strong="H3789"\w* a \w letter|strong="H5612"\w* to \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, and \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* \add it\add* by the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w*.

And he \w wrote|strong="H3789"\w* in the \w letter|strong="H5612"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Set|strong="H3051"\w* ye \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w* in the \w forefront|strong="H6440"\w* of the \w hottest|strong="H2389"\w* \w battle|strong="H4421"\w*, and \w retire|strong="H7725"\w* ye from \w him|strong="H0310"\w*, that he may be \w smitten|strong="H5221"\w*, and \w die|strong="H4191"\w*.\f + \fr 11.15 \ft hottest: Heb. strong\f*\f + \fr 11.15 \ft from him: Heb. from after him\f*

And it came to pass, when \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w observed|strong="H8104"\w* the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, that he \w assigned|strong="H5414"\w* \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w* unto a \w place|strong="H4725"\w* where he \w knew|strong="H3045"\w* that \w valiant|strong="H2428"\w* \w men|strong="H0582"\w* \add were\add*.

And the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* went \w out|strong="H3318"\w*, and \w fought|strong="H3898"\w* with \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*: and there \w fell|strong="H5307"\w* \add some\add* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of the \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* of \w David|strong="H1732"\w*; and \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w* the \w Hittite|strong="H2850"\w* \w died|strong="H4191"\w* also.
¶ Then \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* and \w told|strong="H5046"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* all the \w things|strong="H1697"\w* concerning the \w war|strong="H4421"\w*;

And \w charged|strong="H6680"\w* the \w messenger|strong="H4397"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, When thou hast made an \w end|strong="H3615"\w* of \w telling|strong="H1696"\w* the \w matters|strong="H1697"\w* of the \w war|strong="H4421"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*,

And if so be that the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w wrath|strong="H2534"\w* \w arise|strong="H5927"\w*, and he \w say|strong="H0559"\w* unto thee, Wherefore approached ye so \w nigh|strong="H5066"\w* unto the \w city|strong="H5892"\w* when ye did \w fight|strong="H3898"\w*? \w knew|strong="H3045"\w* ye not that they would \w shoot|strong="H3384"\w* from the \w wall|strong="H2346"\w*?

Who \w smote|strong="H5221"\w* \w Abimelech|strong="H0040"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Jerubbesheth|strong="H3380"\w*? did not a \w woman|strong="H0802"\w* \w cast|strong="H7993"\w* a \w piece|strong="H6400"\w* of a \w millstone|strong="H7393"\w* upon him from the \w wall|strong="H2346"\w*, that he \w died|strong="H4191"\w* in \w Thebez|strong="H8405"\w*? why went ye \w nigh|strong="H5066"\w* the \w wall|strong="H2346"\w*? then \w say|strong="H0559"\w* thou, Thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w* the \w Hittite|strong="H2850"\w* is \w dead|strong="H4191"\w* also.\f + \fr 11.21 \ft Jerubbesheth: also called, Jerubbaal\f*

¶ So the \w messenger|strong="H4397"\w* \w went|strong="H3212"\w*, and \w came|strong="H0935"\w* and \w shewed|strong="H5046"\w* \w David|strong="H1732"\w* all that \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* had \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* him for.

And the \w messenger|strong="H4397"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, Surely the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* \w prevailed|strong="H1396"\w* against us, and came \w out|strong="H3318"\w* unto us into the \w field|strong="H7704"\w*, and we were upon them even unto the \w entering|strong="H6607"\w* of the \w gate|strong="H8179"\w*.

And the \w shooters|strong="H3384"\w* \w shot|strong="H3384"\w* from off the \w wall|strong="H2346"\w* upon thy \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*; and \add some\add* of the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* be \w dead|strong="H4191"\w*, and thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w* the \w Hittite|strong="H2850"\w* is \w dead|strong="H4191"\w* also.

Then \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto the \w messenger|strong="H4397"\w*, Thus shalt thou \w say|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, Let not this \w thing|strong="H1697"\w* \w displease|strong="H3415"\w* thee, for the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w* \w devoureth|strong="H0398"\w* one as well as \w another|strong="H2090"\w*: make thy \w battle|strong="H4421"\w* more \w strong|strong="H2388"\w* against the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, and \w overthrow|strong="H2040"\w* it: and \w encourage|strong="H2388"\w* thou him.\f + \fr 11.25 \ft displease…: Heb. be evil in thine eyes\f*\f + \fr 11.25 \ft one…: Heb. so and such\f*

¶ And when the \w wife|strong="H0802"\w* of \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w* \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* that \w Uriah|strong="H0223"\w* her \w husband|strong="H0376"\w* was \w dead|strong="H4191"\w*, she \w mourned|strong="H5594"\w* for her \w husband|strong="H1167"\w*.

And when the \w mourning|strong="H0060"\w* was \w past|strong="H5674"\w*, \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* and \w fetched|strong="H0622"\w* her to his \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and she became his \w wife|strong="H0802"\w*, and \w bare|strong="H3205"\w* him a \w son|strong="H1121"\w*. But the \w thing|strong="H1697"\w* that \w David|strong="H1732"\w* had \w done|strong="H6213"\w* \w displeased|strong="H3415"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 11.27 \ft displeased: Heb. was evil in the eyes of\f*
